definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: On the desk lay the two books he’d taken from the library two nights ago.
sentences.chinese: 在桌上躺着兩本書他兩個晚上前從圖書館取走的。

sentences.english: Ailey guilty, come home immediately took all the perfume.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉心虛，馬上回家取走了全部的香水。

sentences.english: She cut the lettuce in half and took away the heart.
sentences.chinese: 她將萵苣切成兩半，然後取走了菜心。

definition: to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
to return something to its rightful owner
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
